LanguageData.RG_Messages_QualityDegraded: Due to extensive repairs {0} has lost a level of quality.
LanguageData.RG_Settings_RealisticPreIndustrialWeapon: if disabled, pre-spacer melee weapons and neolithic/medieval weapons will no longer be cost-free until condition drops below 75%, becoming irreparably damaged. Instead, these weapons will be treated like all other repairable items, requiring materials for repair and becoming irraparably damaged at the threshold set below.
LanguageData.RG_Settings_MinimumChance: Minimum repair chance to allow on bills ({0}%)
LanguageData.RG_Settings_MinimumChance_Tooltip: Pawns won't repair an item if their success chance is below this value. This will be ignored if you force a repair job via the item right click menu option.
LanguageData.RG_Settings_RepairChance_Tooltip: Item condition, tech-level, unlocked research, crafting skill level, manipulation, and sight are all taken into consideration in the default calculation of the repair success chance. If you find the final repair chance too challenging use this to boost it up. You can also go lower if you're a masochist.
LanguageData.RG_Settings_PartialSuccessRepairAmount: Gain in condition for partial success ({0}%)
LanguageData.RG_Settings_PartialSuccessRepairAmount_T: This adds an extra challenge, specially for badly damaged items. Resources will be consumed, but the item will only gain this much condition. Set to 100% to opt-out of this feature. NOTE: even with this active, there is still a chance (albeit lower) that the pawn will fully restore an item.
LanguageData.RG_Settings_IrreparablyDamagedThreshold_: Once an item's condition falls below this percentage, you will not be able to repair it.
LanguageData.RG_Settings_CostFreeThreshold_Tooltip: If an item's condition is equal to or greater than this percentage, the repair won't cost any materials.
LanguageData.RG_Settings_QualityDegradation_Tooltip: The lower this value, the more repairs you will be able to do on an item before it loses a level of quality. Set to 0 to disable this feature.
